I actually did this exact same experiment myself about 3-4yrs ago when the original "Ninja Balls" video aired, only I was using them for sock poi in place of tennis balls or beanbags. I did find that the first balloon needed to be tied because the goo will eventually work it's way out. Another filler material I found that works amazingly well are water beads, which can typically be found in the plant section of your local hardware store. They add a rather interesting texture when you squeeze them.
Another finding is that they will all degrade over time. The flour filled ones will eventually dry out the rubber in the balloon and crack. While the goo and water bead filled ones will ultimately dry out in the center and shrivel up.
I've also tried oobleck(cornstarch&water) as a filler. It can be tricky but it definitely produces some interesting results.
